events.originalText: Typhoon Longwang, the deadliest tropical cyclone to hit China in that year, formed just north of the Mariana Islands.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Longwang
events.headline: Typhoon Longwang hits China after forming near Mariana Islands

events.originalText: The Ram Rath Yatra, a political–religious rally organised to erect a temple to the Hindu deity Rama on the site of the Babri Masjid in Ayodhya, began in the Indian state of Gujarat.
events.subtitle: Ram Rath Yatra
events.headline: Ram Rath Yatra begins in Gujarat to build temple for Hindu deity Rama

events.originalText: In one of the largest prison escapes in British history, 38 Provisional Irish Republican Army prisoners hijacked a prison meals lorry and broke out of HM Prison Maze in County Antrim, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: Maze Prison escape
events.headline: 38 IRA prisoners escape HM Prison Maze in British history

events.originalText: Sandra Day O'Connor (pictured) became the first female justice of the Supreme Court of the United States.
events.subtitle: Sandra Day O'Connor
events.headline: Sandra Day O'Connor becomes first female justice of US Supreme Court

events.originalText: About 4,200 people took part in the first modern Chicago Marathon.
events.subtitle: Chicago Marathon
events.headline: First modern Chicago Marathon sees 4,200 participants

events.originalText: The North Yemen Civil War began when Abdullah al-Sallal dethroned the newly crowned Imam al-Badr and declared Yemen to be a republic under his presidency.
events.subtitle: North Yemen Civil War
events.headline: North Yemen Civil War starts with Abdullah al-Sallal's declaration

events.originalText: United States Army troops escorted nine students as Central High School in Little Rock, Arkansas was integrated.
events.subtitle: United States Army
events.headline: US Army escorts students as Central High School integrates in Little Rock

events.originalText: Second World War: British troops began their withdrawal from the Battle of Arnhem in the Netherlands, ending the Allies' Operation Market Garden in defeat.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British troops withdraw from Battle of Arnhem in defeat

events.originalText: An explosion of badly degraded propellant charges on board the French battleship Liberté detonated the forward ammunition magazines and destroyed the ship.
events.subtitle: Propellant
events.headline: Explosion destroys French battleship Liberté

events.originalText: Sequoia National Park (pictured) was established to conserve giant sequoia trees in an area affected by logging in the southern Sierra Nevada in California.
events.subtitle: Sequoia National Park
events.headline: Sequoia National Park established to conserve giant trees in California

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: After U.S. ships became involved, French forces abandoned their invasion of the Batavian island of Curaçao.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: French forces abandon invasion of Curaçao after US involvement

events.originalText: Peking opera was born with the introduction of Hui opera to Beijing by the "Four Great Anhui Troupes" in honour of the Qianlong Emperor's 80th birthday.
events.subtitle: Peking opera
events.headline: Peking opera born in Beijing for Qianlong Emperor's birthday

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Ethan Allen and a small force of American and Quebec militia failed to capture the city of Montreal from British forces.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Ethan Allen fails to capture Montreal in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Ottoman wars in Europe: Ottoman forces under Bayezid I defeated a Christian alliance led by Sigismund of Hungary near present-day Nikopol, Bulgaria.
events.subtitle: Ottoman wars in Europe
events.headline: Ottoman forces defeat Christian alliance near Nikopol, Bulgaria

events.originalText: Henry III of England and Alexander II of Scotland signed the Treaty of York, establishing the Anglo-Scottish border, which mostly remains the same today.
events.subtitle: Henry III of England
events.headline: Treaty of York establishes Anglo-Scottish border by Henry III and Alexander II

events.originalText: Harold Godwinson defeated King Harald III of Norway and his English ally Tostig Godwinson at the Battle of Stamford Bridge, ending the last Norse invasion of the British Isles.
events.subtitle: Harold Godwinson
events.headline: Harold Godwinson defeats King Harald III at Battle of Stamford Bridge

events.originalText: Viking expansion: A Viking fleet arrived near Seville, then part of the Emirate of Córdoba, and began a raid of the city that was eventually repelled by Muslim defenders.
events.subtitle: Viking expansion
events.headline: Viking raid near Seville repelled by Muslim defenders

events.originalText: After the assassination of Aurelian, Tacitus was chosen by the Senate to succeed him as Roman emperor.
events.subtitle: Aurelian
events.headline: Tacitus chosen as Roman emperor after Aurelian's assassination
